text: The Quinnipiac Bobcats program represented Quinnipiac University during the 2014-15 NCAA Division I women's ice hockey season. Their 26 wins were the fifth most in the nation, and they remained nationally ranked throughout the season. Their success earned them a berth in the NCAA Tournament, but they were defeated by their ECAC rivals, Harvard, in the first round. ==Offseason== * The Bobcats travelled to Itay and Switzerland for ten days in August for exhibition games against European teams. ===Recruiting=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:#0a2351;color:#c9b074;" | Player || Position ||Nationality || Notes |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Alicia Barry || Defense || || Played for Assabet Valley |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Shannon Cherpak|| Defense || || Attended Westminster School |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Taylar Cianfarano|| Forward || || Member of Team USA U18 |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Tori DeAngelis|| Forward || || Invitee to Team USA Development Camp |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Rachel Myette || Goaltender || || Led Duxbury HS to Massachusetts State Championship |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Raquel Pennoyer || Forward || || Attended Tabor Academy |- align="center" bgcolor=" " |} == 2014–15 Bobcats == ==Schedule== |- !colspan=12 style=" style="background:#0a2351;color:#c9b074;"| Regular Season |- !colspan=12 style=" style="background:#0a2351;color:#c9b074;"| ECAC Tournament |- !colspan=12 style=" style="background:#0a2351;color:#c9b074;"| NCAA Tournament ==Awards and honors== *ECAC Team Sportsmanship Award *Chelsea Laden, Mandi Schwartz ECAC Student Athlete of the Year *Chelsea Laden, G, All-ECAC Second Team *Nicole Kosta, F, All-ECAC Third Team *Taylar Cianfarano, F, All ECAC Rookie Team *Chelsea Laden was fourth nationally in Goals Against Average (1.19) ==References== Quinnipiac Category:Quinnipiac Bobcats women's ice hockey seasons Quinnipiac
